title: Add personalized messaging, fix theme switcher, create Tasks tab, and add exercise category tabs

requirements.summary: Add personalized fade-out message to landing page
acceptanceCriteria: The message 'mylove i know you can do this so i made this for youðŸ™‚' appears on the landing page
The message fades out smoothly as the user scrolls down the page
The fade effect uses opacity transition and is triggered by scroll position

file_operations.description: Add a personalized message 'mylove i know you can do this so i made this for youðŸ™‚' at the top of the landing page. Implement scroll-triggered fade-out animation using opacity transition based on scroll position (e.g., fade from opacity 1 to 0 as user scrolls down the first 300-500px). Position the message prominently above or within the hero section.

requirements.summary: Add subtle hidden compliments scattered throughout the app
acceptanceCriteria: Multiple small compliment texts are scattered across different pages of the application
The compliments use subtle styling (low opacity, small font size) making them hard to spot but readable when found
Compliments are positioned in various locations to create a hidden treasure hunt effect

file_operations.description: Add 2-3 small compliment texts (e.g., 'you're amazing', 'so proud of you') scattered across the landing page using subtle styling: low opacity (0.1-0.2), small font size (8-10px), and positioned in corners or margins to be hard to spot but readable.
Add 1-2 hidden compliment texts to the walk tracking page using subtle styling (low opacity, small font) positioned near map edges or statistics display.
Add 1-2 hidden compliment texts to the transformation page using subtle styling positioned around the photo upload area or transformation preview.
Add 1-2 hidden compliment texts to the stats page using subtle styling positioned near statistics cards.
Add 1 hidden compliment text to the settings page using subtle styling positioned in an unobtrusive corner.

requirements.summary: Remove orange/golden fitness hero image from landing page
acceptanceCriteria: The orange/golden dramatic fitness transformation hero image is completely removed from the landing page
No broken image references or empty containers remain after removal
The landing page layout adjusts gracefully without the hero image

file_operations.description: Remove the hero image (frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-fitness.dim_1920x1080.png) from the landing page. Remove any tags, background-image styles, or container elements that reference this image. Adjust spacing and layout to ensure the page looks clean without the hero image.

requirements.summary: Fix color theme switcher functionality in Settings
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking on different theme options in Settings successfully changes the application's color scheme
The selected theme is applied immediately across all components
The theme selection persists after page refresh
Visual feedback indicates which theme is currently active

file_operations.description: Fix the theme switching logic to ensure theme changes are properly applied. Verify that setTheme calls the backend actor method correctly and that CSS custom properties are updated. Ensure theme persistence works by checking localStorage or backend storage and that the theme is reloaded on mount.

Fix the ThemeSelector component to ensure clicking theme options triggers theme changes. Verify event handlers are properly connected to the ThemeContext's setTheme function. Add loading states if needed and ensure visual feedback (checkmark) updates correctly when theme changes.

requirements.summary: Create separate Tasks tab with daily fitness challenges
acceptanceCriteria: A new 'Tasks' tab appears in the main navigation separate from existing tabs
The Tasks page displays daily fitness challenges with checkboxes
Default tasks include: walk a mile, run half a mile, 20 squats, and at least 3 additional varied fitness challenges
Each task can be marked as complete with a checkbox

file_operations.description: Create a new Tasks page component that fetches daily tasks from the backend using getDailyTasks(). Display tasks in a list with checkboxes, showing task descriptions. Include default tasks: walk a mile, run half a mile, 20 squats, and at least 3 additional varied fitness tasks (e.g., 15 push-ups, 30-second plank, 50 jumping jacks). When a checkbox is clicked, call the backend setTaskCompleted(taskId) mutation to mark the task complete. Show loading and error states. Style with consistent theme colors.
Add a new protected route for the Tasks page at path '/tasks' that renders the TasksPage component. Ensure it is included within the ProtectedRoute wrapper alongside other authenticated routes.

Add a new 'Tasks' navigation link to the header menu (both desktop and mobile) that routes to '/tasks'. Position it separately from other tabs as specified. Ensure the active state is highlighted when on the Tasks page.

Add a React Query hook useDailyTasks() that fetches daily tasks using actor.getDailyTasks(). Add a mutation useSetTaskCompleted(taskId: bigint) that calls actor.setTaskCompleted(taskId) and invalidates the daily tasks query on success.

requirements.summary: Display gym-themed 'Well Done' animation on task completion
acceptanceCriteria: When all daily tasks are checked off, a celebration animation appears
The animation has a gym theme with fitness-related visual elements
The animation displays 'Well Done' as the primary message
The animation is visually distinct and rewarding

file_operations.description: Create a celebration animation component that displays 'Well Done' with a gym theme. Use CSS animations or a library like Framer Motion to create an engaging animation with fitness-related visual elements (e.g., animated weights, confetti, pulsing effects). The animation should be visually distinct and rewarding, appearing as a modal or overlay.

Integrate the TaskCompletionAnimation component. When all daily tasks are marked complete (check the tasks array to verify all have completed: true), trigger and display the 'Well Done' animation overlay. Ensure the animation only appears when transitioning from incomplete to all-complete state.

requirements.summary: Show reward selection after completing all daily tasks
acceptanceCriteria: After completing all daily tasks, a multiple-choice reward selection appears
Reward options include: date night, sleepover, massage, and at least 2 additional romantic/personal rewards
The reward selection only appears when all tasks for the current day are completed
Users can select one reward option from the presented choices

file_operations.description: Create a reward selection component that displays multiple-choice reward options: date night, sleepover, massage, and at least 2 additional options (e.g., movie night, breakfast in bed). Present options as cards or buttons. Allow user to select one reward and provide visual feedback on selection. Style with theme colors.

Show the RewardSelector component after the TaskCompletionAnimation when all daily tasks are completed. Ensure it only appears when all tasks for the current day are marked complete. Handle reward selection and store the choice (can be frontend-only or sent to backend if needed).

requirements.summary: Add new exercise category tabs to navigation
acceptanceCriteria: At least 3 new tabs are added to the main navigation for exercise categories
Exercise categories are clearly distinct (e.g., Upper Body, Lower Body, Core, Cardio)
Each category tab displays a curated list of relevant exercise ideas
Exercise ideas include names, descriptions, and basic instructions

file_operations.description: Create an exercise category page component that accepts a category parameter (e.g., 'Upper Body', 'Lower Body', 'Core'). Fetch exercises for the category using getExercisesByCategory(category) from the backend. Display exercises in cards or lists showing name, description, and basic instructions. Handle loading and error states. Style with theme colors.

Add protected routes for at least 3 exercise category pages: '/exercises/upper-body', '/exercises/lower-body', '/exercises/core'. Each route renders the ExerciseCategoryPage component with the appropriate category prop.

Add navigation links for at least 3 exercise category tabs: 'Upper Body', 'Lower Body', 'Core' in both desktop and mobile menus. Links should route to '/exercises/upper-body', '/exercises/lower-body', '/exercises/core' respectively. Highlight active state when on the corresponding page.
Add a React Query hook useExercisesByCategory(category: string) that fetches exercises using actor.getExercisesByCategory(category). Enable query when category is provided.

requirements.summary: Add more customization options to Settings page
acceptanceCriteria: Settings page includes at least 3 additional configuration options beyond theme selection
New settings are relevant to the fitness app context (e.g., units, notifications preferences, display options)
Settings changes are saved and persisted across sessions
Each setting has clear labels and intuitive controls

file_operations.description: Create a customization settings component that displays at least 3 additional settings: font size (small/medium/large), background music preference (on/off or selection), and units preference (metric/imperial). Fetch current customizations using getCustomizations() and provide controls (dropdowns, toggles, radio buttons) with clear labels. Save changes using setCustomizations(fontSize, backgroundMusic) mutation.
Integrate the CustomizationSettings component into the Settings page below the theme selector. Ensure the layout is clean and settings are organized in sections or cards.

Add a React Query hook useCustomizations() that fetches customizations using actor.getCustomizations(). Add a mutation useSetCustomizations(fontSize: bigint, backgroundMusic: string) that calls actor.setCustomizations and invalidates the customizations query on success.

requirements.summary: Clean up and polish overall UI for smooth, cohesive experience
acceptanceCriteria: Consistent spacing, padding, and margins across all pages
Smooth transitions and animations throughout the application
Visual hierarchy is clear with proper typography sizing and weights
Color scheme is applied consistently across all UI elements
No visual glitches, alignment issues, or broken layouts

file_operations.description: Review and refine global CSS styles for consistency. Ensure Tailwind base styles are properly applied. Verify smooth transitions are defined for interactive elements. Check that color variables (OKLCH) are consistent across light/dark modes. Add any missing global animation definitions for smooth UI interactions.

Polish the Layout component for consistent spacing and alignment. Ensure header, navigation, footer, and decorative elements have proper padding and margins. Verify smooth transitions on navigation state changes. Check that decorative weight/nature elements are positioned correctly and don't interfere with content.

Review spacing, typography, and visual hierarchy on the landing page. Ensure headings, buttons, and feature sections have consistent sizing and spacing. Verify gradient text and CTAs are visually prominent. Check that the layout is clean after hero image removal.

Polish the walk tracking page layout. Ensure map and statistics are properly aligned with consistent spacing. Verify smooth transitions when starting/stopping tracking. Check that controls and stats cards have proper visual hierarchy.

Clean up the transformation page layout. Ensure photo uploader, duration selector, and transformation preview have consistent spacing and alignment. Verify smooth transitions during upload and preview display.

Review stats page for consistent card spacing, typography, and visual hierarchy. Ensure gradient backgrounds and icons are properly aligned. Verify that metrics display clearly with appropriate font sizes and weights.
Polish the settings page layout. Ensure theme selector and customization settings sections have consistent spacing and visual grouping. Verify all controls are properly aligned and labeled.
Ensure the new Tasks page has consistent spacing, clean task list layout, and smooth checkbox interactions. Verify visual hierarchy is clear with proper typography for task descriptions.
Polish the exercise category page layout. Ensure exercise cards have consistent spacing, typography, and visual hierarchy. Verify descriptions and instructions are readable and well-organized.
